TopicTitle: 2 ideas in 1 thread: Spotlights and alien trees

Articles.Content:
Alien trees: Sure animals on other planets would take way to much work, but what about unique trees from others planets? On all trees you can do material samples which can earn you some extra science.

Spotlight:

------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Spotlight x12

Manufacturer: RKEA Inc.

Cost: 250

Tech: Electrics

Mass: 0.03

Drag: 0.2

Crash Tolerance: 12 m/s

Max temperature: 3200o

Electric Charge required: 3.6/min

Details: Spotlights are like Illuminator Mk1, but 2x brighter, and can also see twice as far, and they just look cooler in general!
Trees on other planets? The system in the game is an analog for real life, none of our worlds have trees, or could support them. How do you propose to have these trees survive?
"look cooler in general" huh, that is rather subjective. i personally like the b9 spotlights (at least i think that is where they are from... the 8 rectangular spots in a cluster?).

B9 has awesome lights. So does the aviation lights pack as well.

Trees that live in a vacuum on rock with no water? Where's the problem?
Laythe could use some trees. Or any other kind of excuse for its oxygen atmosphere.
